instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
I have an 820-00165 with no fan spin after liquid damage.
Orange light and SMC reset goes green and back to orange.

Liquid damage around U5110 cleaned up.

PPBUS_G3H = 8.52v
PP5V_S5 = 4.98v
PP3V3_S5 = 3.32v
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0v
SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3v
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.4v
PP3V3_SUS = 3.301v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.53v

R1300 pin1 = 3.302v - pin2 = 3.296v
R1301 pin1 = 3.302v - pin2 = 3.030v
R1302 pin1 = 3.302v - pin2 = 3.208v
R1303 pin1 = 3.302v - pin2 = 3.296v

JTAG obviously removed, replaced the burnt LVDS connector.

I’m not sure where to go from here.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_S4_L = 0v"
No pulse at all when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L

Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
PM_BATLOW_L is high, original Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
OMG! I've been testing with the wrong charger. Such a noob sometimes, I should have known better.

Now turns on, fans normal, CPU heats up but nothing on the screen. No backlight or screen activating

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Did you test external video and USB activity?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
I don't have a way to test external at the moment but it does power a USB mouse.
Tried another screen assembly also

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Maybe LP8550 issue or would that still initialise the display if that was faulty?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
On U8300 I get 0v on pin 1 (EDP_PANEL_PWR) but I'm getting 3.3v on pin 2 and 3

R1431 is the pull up resistor for EDP_PANEL_PWR and its supposed to be 100k but tests as 82k on the board.
Do you think this might be an issue or is something pulling that down a touch while its attached to the board?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
I didn't ask for USB power.
Does the mouse get steady light if you disconnect/reconnect it when board is turned on?

Looks like no image, why do you search for backlight then?
DP_INT_HPD goes high?
Check in the first 10s, if pulses at least...

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
The light on the mouse I use is bright and then dims after 5 seconds. I think this is normal as it does it on my iMac just the same.
DP_INT_HPD is 0.00v I can't see any pulses or maybe my multimeter is too slow.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
"DP_INT_HPD is 0.00v"
You vannot get image, nor backlight.

Use bootable pendrive with Link LED; if flashes, there is USB activity 100%.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: USB pendrive flashes a few times each time I plug it in

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Yes, no image, no backlight

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Start with bootable USB connected and internal SSD removed.
The pendrive MUST flash continuously, like charging OSX...

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
I've tested with two seperate USB that I know will boot. Neither of them flash continuously like it is booting the OS.

Tried with internal SSD removed also, don't think it is trying to boot.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
As I imagined, no USB activity.
Your board doesn't boot, or gets stuck.
There is no reason to search for video.

Try known good BIOS...

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Bios chip swapped but doesn't seem to have changed

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Do you get PLT_RESET_L?

Did you swap the BIOS chip from working board?
Don't you have a programmer to write a known good (clean ME) BIOS?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L is 3.3v

The BIOS chip was from a dropped 820-00165 (dead CPU) so the bios should be okay but I suppose it could be also faulty.

The only programmer I have is SOFI SP8 for doing bios locks on the old A1278/A1286 boards. I haven't programmed the bios on A1466 before, sorry.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

You should also reball SMC.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Tested all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors

R6110
R6111
R6112
R6113
R6118
R6119

R6114
R6115
R6116
R6117

R6120
R6121
R6122
R6123
R6130
R6131

R6133
R6132
R6128
R6127
R6126
R6125

All test as schematic, can't see any issues with traces on the microscope.

Going to reball the SMC now

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: not sure if the SMC didn't survive the heat cycle or I messed it up, but I have no fan spin at the moment. SMC looks like its on perfectly under the microscope. Looks like I'll have to take it back off.

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
If this happened when reballed the SMC, you have a problem there now.
SMC is very resistant to heat; more likely bad solders.
Try a reflow and gently tap it...

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Okay, I'll heat it up and give it a couple of taps and little nudges. Its dancing while at reflow

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message: Nope, get green and orange light but no fan spin. I'll have to start again

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Actually.. tried one more time and got fan spin back.. I now have screen active but no backlight.
I can see it booting OSX

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
So you get image now?
Post BKLT_EN/PWM.
Did you try PRAM reset (2-3 times)?

threads.title: 820-00165 liquid, no fan spin but orange light  [solved]
threads.message:
Swapped out LP8550. (looking at the state of the LVDS connector originally, I'm not surprised it was dead) now works perfectly.

As ever [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] thank you for your help.
